citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Avibacterium avium (Hinz and Kunjara 1977) comb. nov.
Basonym: Haemophilus avium Hinz and Kunjara 1977.
Growth on blood agar is symbiotic.
Catalase and phosphatase reactions are positive.
Acid is produced from d-galactose and trehalose.
Acid is not produced from l-arabinose, d-arabinose, meso-inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, lactose or maltose.
Acid production from d-xylose is variable.
The genome mass and DNA G+C content are 1·9×109 Da and 44·7 mol%, respectively (Mutters et al., 1985a).
